label: 徳川吉宗
本: The Cambridge History of Japan, Volume 4:  Early Modern Japan . Cambridge University Press . 1991
説明文: (r. 1716-45)  The eighth shogun was selected from the Kii branch of the Tokugawa house.  Having served as a daimyo for some ten years, he came to the office of the shogunate iwth a reputation as a strong administrator.  Upon his transfer to Edo Castle he undertook the first major revision" of the bakufu system:  the so-called Kyōhō Reforms.  Proclaimed as a "return to Ieyasu's legacy," it sought to expand the bakufu's finances, clean up corruption in the land-tax system, and improve morale among lesser vassals of the shogun by bettering their financial status (p. 21). [紀伊、享保改革、家康]"
